intro: Hibbertia mollis, commonly known as the soft-hair wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Hibbertia mollis is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with slender, branched stems. Its flowers bloom in spring and are followed by small, spherical fruits.
